channel.title: Data Analysis on Rob Barry
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analysis on Rob Barry

item.title: Millions of Mail-in Ballots at Risk in Battleground States
item.description: Millions of mail-in ballots haven’t been received by election offices in critical battleground states, where recent slowdowns in mail deliveries risk some votes not arriving in time to count for the presidential election. Read the full story here.

item.title: How Delayed Is Your Mail-In Ballot?
item.description: Of the 29 states that require mail-in ballots to arrive on or before election day, 28 have seen periods in recent weeks of average delivery times of more than six days, a Wall Street Journal analysis found. Read the full story here.

item.title: Why We Don't Know How Many Americans Are Infected With Coronavirus--and Might Never Know
item.description: Sparse testing is just one reason the official tally is far too low, but the numbers will get more reliable over time. Read the full story here.
